channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: During TV interview, President Trump questions due process rights of U.S. residents
item.description: During an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press," President Trump questioned the due process rights of people in the United States.

item.title: Talk therapy is on the rise
item.description: The number of Americans relying on psychotherapy went up between 2018 and 2021, whereas the number of people using psychiatric medications went down.

item.title: What to know about the papal conclave
item.description: The College of Cardinals gathers this week to elect the next pope to lead the Catholic Church. But what preparations go into setting up the rare, secretive event?

item.title: Ahead of the conclave, the Sistine Chapel takes center stage
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with art historian Kim Butler about the artwork that adorns the walls of the Sistine Chapel and its significance ahead of the conclave to elect the next pope.

item.title: Stranded Soviet spacecraft to plunge back to Earth
item.description: NPR's Don Gonyea speaks with astrophysicist Jonathan McDowell about Kosmos 482, the Soviet-era spacecraft that was stranded over 50 years ago during a mission to Venus. It will soon return to Earth.

item.title: U.S. autoworkers react to Trump's tariff policies
item.description: President Trump has repeatedly promised that he would save the U.S. auto industry and that aggressive tariffs would drive that industry revival. But how are U.S. autoworkers feeling?

item.title: Mississippi lawmakers eliminate the state income tax. How will that affect residents?
item.description: Mississippi lawmakers voted to do something that other GOP-led states have been talking about: eliminating the state income tax. But it's not clear where the state will get the money it needs.

item.title: How this teen fled Russian occupation and became a hero in Ukraine
item.description: An 18-year-old from Russian-occupied Luhansk tells NPR how and why he escaped to Kyiv.

item.title: After his burial, visitors flock to Pope Francis's tomb.
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow visits the Basilica where Pope Francis has been laid to rest.

item.title: Economic uncertainty remains amid Trump's tariffs
item.description: It's been a month since President Trump announced his worldwide tariffs. Since then, there have been escalations and tariff retribution from other countries, then tariff pauses.
